verses.verse: Lament over the Destruction of Jerusalem (Neh 1.4; Ezek 1.1, 3) By the rivers of Babylon— there we sat down, and there we wept when we remembered Zion.
On the willows (Or poplars) there we hung up our harps.
(Ps 80.6) For there our captors asked us for songs, and our tormentors asked for mirth, saying, “Sing us one of the songs of Zion!”
How could we sing the LORD’s song in a foreign land?
If I forget you, O Jerusalem, let my right hand wither!
(Ezek 3.26) Let my tongue cling to the roof of my mouth, if I do not remember you, if I do not set Jerusalem above my highest joy.
(Jer 49.7; Lam 4.22; Ezek 25.12; Ob 10-14) Remember, O LORD, against the Edomites the day of Jerusalem’s fall, how they said, “Tear it down! Tear it down! Down to its foundations!”
(Isa 13.1, 6; Jer 25.12; 50.15; Rev 18.6) O daughter Babylon, you devastator! (Or you who are devastated) Happy shall they be who pay you back what you have done to us!
(2 Kings 8.12; Isa 13.16) Happy shall they be who take your little ones and dash them against the rock!
